intro: Pimelea longiflora var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved silky peacock wattles, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
